page.title: 06Prince Philip's visit June85
page.content: On 13th June Prince Philip visited Cambridge. He travelled by helicopter and landed on the main lawn of Downing college where he had lunch with the vicechancellor of the university and Master of the college, Sir JB Butter- field and many other guests. In the afternoon he went on a procession through the town. As chancellor of the university, Prince Philip presented many honorary degrees at the Senate house. These included Baroness Wootton (the first woman life peer and a pupil of the Perse school for Girls ) who was made a doctor of law. Princess Anne visited Cambridge the same day to receive funds from school children for the Save the Children Fund to help the starving in Ethiopia. Prince Edward, who had just finished studying at the university,returned to Buckingham Palace with his father and sister.
